required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy and Tolerability of Various Bowel Preps in Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Tolerability of Various Bowel Preparations in Diabetic Patients: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Poor bowel preparation and patient intolerance of the procedure are the most important factors contributing to the limitation of colonoscopy. Inadequate bowel cleansing results in incomplete testing, increased potential to miss lesions, increased cost, and decreased patient satisfaction. The investigators hope to gain better insight into which bowel preparation works best in diabetic patients and hence would increase patient satisfaction, tolerability of the bowel preparation and decrease overall costs. The investigators will investigate which bowel preparation for colonoscopy will work optimally in diabetic patients using three different regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Measure the % of Participants With Effective (How Well the Colon is Cleansed Using the Validated Boston Bowel Preparation Scale) for Various Bowel Preparations for Colonoscopy.
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will measure the number/% of participants who will have good to excellent bowel preparations defined by the Boston Bowel Prep Scale(BBPS) with a score of 6 or more, rated by blinded colonoscopist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure of Patients Who Develop (Tolerance)Side Effects of Taking Bowel Preparations.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Who Developed Side Effects of Taking Bowel Preparations

arm_group.description: 4 liters of polyethylene glycol electrolyte lavage solution (PEG-ELS-(GoLytely)+ placebo pill
split dose(2 L day before procedure and 2 L day of procedure) of 4 liters of Golytely + placebo pill
split dose (2 L day prior to procedure and 2 L day of procedure) of 4 liters of Golytely + bisacodyl 10 mg

intervention.intervention_name: Golytely (polyethylene glycol electrolyte lavage solution) and placebo
intervention.description: 4 liters of polyethylene glycol electrolyte lavage solution (PEG-ELS-(GoLytely))+ placebo given the evening prior to the colonoscopy

intervention.intervention_name: split dose of Golytely (polyethylene glycol electrolyte lavage solution) + placebo
intervention.description: split dose (2 L taken the evening before and 2 L taken the morning of the colonoscopy) of 4 liters Golytely + placebo

intervention.intervention_name: split dose of Golytely (polyethylene glycol electrolyte lavage solution) and bisacodyl
intervention.description: split dose ( 2 L taken the evening before and 2 L taken the morning of the colonoscopy) of 4 liters of Golytely + bisacodyl 10 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult diabetic outpatients referred for elective colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients < 18 years of age or > 75 yrs of age,
- known or suspected pregnancy,
- known or suspected renal failure,
- unstable angina,
- acute coronary syndrome,
- decompensated congestive heart failure,
- decompensated liver failure,
- known or suspected bowel obstruction,
- major psychiatric illness,
- solid organ transplant patients,
- known allergies to PEG-ELS or bisacodyl,
- prior alimentary tract surgery or refusal to consent to the study.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Oklahoma Health Science Center

outcome.title: Measure the % of Participants With Effective (How Well the Colon is Cleansed Using the Validated Boston Bowel Preparation Scale) for Various Bowel Preparations for Colonoscopy.
outcome.description: The investigators will measure the number/% of participants who will have good to excellent bowel preparations defined by the Boston Bowel Prep Scale(BBPS) with a score of 6 or more, rated by blinded colonoscopist.
outcome.population: We have missing data regarding reporting of Boston bowel preparation scores (BBPS), some providers didn't provide the BBPS and provided only subjective assessment of the bowel preparation (for example, good or excellent)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
